alert.note: Alert for Athens; Morgan; Perry; Vinton; Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 12:49AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Perry, Washington, Morgan, northeastern Vinton and Athens Counties through 115 AM EDT... At 1248 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near McConnelsville to near Glouster to near Lancaster. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Athens, Marietta, Nelsonville, New Lexington, Glouster, McConnelsville, Beverly, Shawnee, Chesterhill, Lake Hope State Park, Vienna, Williamstown, Boaz, Crooksville, Chauncey, Junction City, New Straitsville, Malta, Corning and Buchtel. This includes Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 1 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, seek shelter inside a building until the storms pass. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 AM EDT for southeastern Ohio.
